Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; exterior, white slip: black speck preserved in upper frieze; below, frieze bounded by black bands with superimposed red band lined in white; black-figure frieze decoration consisting of griffin seated to left (part of wing, body, rump, tail, and legs remaining); tail of second animal, probably griffin to right; dot rosettes, pinwheel rosettes, dots, dotted crosses, and dashes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.046)
